snippet: Ben S. Bernanke, the head of the Federal Reserve, called the unemployment rate a “grave concern,” reinforcing signs that the Fed would take further steps to stimulate growth.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairman Ben S Bernanke delivers a detailed and forceful argument for new steps to stimulate the economy, reinforcing earlier indications that the Fed is on the verge of action; Bernanke calls the persistently high rate of unemployment a 'grave concern,' language that several experts describe as unusually strong.
lead_paragraph: Ben S. Bernanke, the head of the Federal Reserve, called the unemployment rate a “grave concern,” reinforcing signs that the Fed would take further steps to stimulate growth.

headline.seo: Bernanke Speech Makes Detailed Case for Fed Action
headline.main: Fed Chairman Makes Case, in Strong Terms, for New Action
headline.print_headline: Fed Chief Makes A Detailed Case For a Stimulus
